intro: Urera amberana, commonly known as the yellow urera, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and ornamental horticulture.
